candidates.title: feat: wrap cells of wide tables
candidates.body: Emulates [Pandoc's cell-wrapping behavior for tables](https://pandoc.org/MANUAL.html#extension-pipe_tables) to prevent wide tables from overflowing the page

candidates.title: feat: wrap long lines in code blocks
candidates.body:
Uses the [`fvextra` package](https://mirror.mwt.me/ctan/macros/latex/contrib/fvextra/fvextra.pdf) to enable line wrapping in code blocks in LaTeX books.

TODO:
- [x] ~Really long lines result in errors (see rustc-dev-guide, https://github.com/Wandmalfarbe/pandoc-latex-template/issues/122#issuecomment-538011690)~
    Resolved by wrapping really long lines in `\texttt{}`
- [x] ~Wrap long lines in code blocks with no language infostring (i.e., ```)~
    Resolved by replacing empty infostrings with "text"

candidates.title: feat: pass metadata from `[book]` table to Pandoc
Pass options to Pandoc as defaults file instead of command-line arguments
candidates.body: As a result, some options must be specified with different names--in particular, `output` becomes `output-file`

candidates.title: Support lists nested more than four levels deep when rendering to LaTeX
candidates.body: LaTeX by default can't handle lists with more than four levels of items. If necessary to render the book, this adds a dependency on the `enumitem` package to support more nested lists.

candidates.title: Support older versions of Pandoc (with possibly degraded output)
candidates.body:
Supports older versions of Pandoc by selectively enabling extensions based on the Pandoc version. The preprocessor will avoid adding dependencies on unavailable extensions but there are no fallback mechanisms, so this will likely result in degraded output with older versions of Pandoc.

- [x] Take available extensions into account while preprocessing source
- [x] Only emit warnings about unavailable extensions that are actually needed

Closes #35

candidates.title: Download remote images that pandoc doesn't handle on its own
candidates.body:
Closes #18

> Pandoc currently doesn't support using URLs with paths that do not have standard image extensions (e.g. `.png`, `.svg`) as image destinations.
>
> For example, pandoc will not process the following GitHub actions badge from [shields.io](https://shields.io):
> ```md 
> ![Build](https://img.shields.io/github/actions/workflow/status/max-heller/mdbook-pandoc/ci.yml?style=flat-square) 
> ```

This implements a heuristic fix to download images that pandoc is known not to support.

candidates.title: Fix release workflow
candidates.body: The `rust-cache` action in the release workflow currently breaks because this repo's submodules contain a lot of `Cargo.toml` and `Cargo.lock` files. This will be fixed by https://github.com/Swatinem/rust-cache/pull/180, but for now this PR disables cloning submodules during the release workflow.

candidates.title: Update `cargo-dist`
candidates.body: Updates `cargo-dist` from v0.4.3->v0.5.0 and enable building shell and powershell installers

## [0.1.2] - 2023-12-01 ### Bug Fixes - Escape quotes within link titles ([#6](https://github.com/max-heller/mdbook-pandoc/pull/6)) ### Performance - Eliminate redundant processing of tags during start and end events ([#10](https://github.com/max-heller/mdbook-pandoc/pull/10)) ### Miscellaneous Tasks - Only include necessary files in released packages ([#8](https://github.com/max-heller/mdbook-pandoc/pull/8)) - Run CI clippy workflow on Windows and MacOS in addition to Ubuntu ([#7](https://github.com/max-heller/mdbook-pandoc/pull/7)) - Update version of `cargo-dist` used to generate releases ([#12](https://github.com/max-heller/mdbook-pandoc/pull/12)) - Fix CI release workflow ([#13](https://github.com/max-heller/mdbook-pandoc/pull/13))

candidates.title: chore: explicitly include files for cargo packaging
candidates.body: Prevents `cargo package` from including unnecessary files, in particular the `books` subdirectory

candidates.title: fix: escape quotes within link titles
candidates.body:
Before, link titles that contained quotes would be rendered without their interior quotes escaped and preprocessing would turn
```md
[link](dest "\"weird title\"")
```
into
```md
[link](dest ""weird title"")
```
resulting in a broken link.

This was due to a bug in `pulldown-cmark-to-cmark` fixed in https://github.com/Byron/pulldown-cmark-to-cmark/pull/62 and released in version 11.0.2, so this PR bumps the version requirement.
